intro: Suttonia hillebrandii var. emarginata, commonly known as the emarginated suttonia, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring notched or lobed margins that give it a striking appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often within cloud forests or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in shades of white or pale pink, and are adapted for pollination by specific insect species. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
